Welcome to Research in Health Economics! We're going to have a great time this semester and learn a ton about causal inference and health policy.

### Objectives

- Get (more) comfortable with `R`, `RStudio`, `Git`, and `GitHub`
- Work with some Medicare Advantage data

### Activities 

- Data manipulation with the `tidyverse`
- First [weekly check-in](/assignment/weekly-check-in.html) due on Friday.
- Clone [Medicare Advantage repository](https://github.com/imccart/Medicare-Advantage) and begin working with data 

### Readings
- Lesson 2 from [Data Science for Economists](https://github.com/uo-ec607/lectures). This is part of a course from [Grant McDermott](https://grantmcdermott.com/) with a ton of great online resources.
- [R for Data Science](https://r4ds.had.co.nz/), to help with data manipulation in the `tidyverse`
